Default
```js
initialState = {};
<div>
  <Radio>
    <input
      ref="radio1"
      type="radio"
      id="radio1"
      name="radionoborder"
    />
    <label style={{marginRight: '10px'}} htmlFor="radio1" title="radio">radio1</label>
    <input
      ref="radio2"
      type="radio"
      id="radio2"
      name="radionoborder"
    />
    <label style={{marginRight: '10px'}} htmlFor="radio2" title="radio">radio2</label>
    <input
      ref="radio3"
      type="radio"
      id="radio3"
      name="radionoborder"
    />
    <label style={{marginRight: '10px'}} htmlFor="radio3" title="radio">radio3</label>
  </Radio>
</div>
```
Border
```js
initialState = {};
<div style={{display: 'flex'}}>
  <Radio border>
    <input
      ref="radio4"
      type="radio"
      id="radio4"
      name="radioborder"
    />
    <label style={{marginRight: '10px'}} htmlFor="radio4" title="radio">radio4</label>
  </Radio>
  <Radio border>

      type="radio"
      id="radio5"
      name="radioborder"

```

Purple
```js
initialState = {};
<div style={{display: 'flex'}}>
  <Radio colorStyle="purple">
    <input
      ref="radio7"
      type="radio"
      id="radio7"
      name="purple"
    />
    <label style={{marginRight: '10px'}} htmlFor="radio7" title="radio">radio7</label>
  </Radio>
  <Radio colorStyle="purple">
    <input
      ref="radio8"
      type="radio"
      id="radio8"
      name="purple"
    />
    <label style={{marginRight: '10px'}} htmlFor="radio8" title="radio">radio8</label>
  </Radio>
  <Radio colorStyle="purple">
    <input
      ref="radio9"

    />
    <label style={{marginRight: '10px'}} htmlFor="radio9" title="radio">radio9</label>

</div>
```

Using content prop
```js
initialState = {};
<Radio
  onChange={(data) => {console.log(data);}}
  content={[
    {name: 'radio 1', value: 'radio1'},
    {name: 'radio 2', value: 'radio2'},
    {name: 'radio 3', value: 'radio3'}
  ]}
/>
```
